str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phos; to shed rays, i.e. To shine or to brighten up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From krupto; concealed, i.e. Private.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Counsel, deliberate wisdom, decree. From boulomai; volition, i.e. advice, or purpose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Commendation, praise, approval. From epi and the base of aineo; laudation; concretely, a commendable thing.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
